summary: Creates a copy of a portion of the given array, filtered down to just the elements that pass the test implemented by the provided graph.
description:
Filters a given array by calling a provided graph on each element, keeping only the elements for which the corresponding graph activates the control port True.
This block is able to filter any ArrayIn array type to any output array type.
The inner graph needs to be edited to provide the filtering process.

dataPorts.ArrayIn:
The input array to be filtered.
This data port handles all array types.
dataPorts.SharedData:
The data to share accross each internal graph instance.
This data port handles all types.
If several data with different types need to be shared then the creation of a user type is recommended.
dataPorts.ArrayOut:
The filtered output array.
This data port handles all array types.
The size of this array won't exceed the ArrayIn array size.
dataPorts.State:
An array of ArrayFilterState giving the EExecutionState at each index of the Success output array.
The size of this array will always be equal to the ArrayIn array size.
dataPorts.Progress:
An array of ArrayFilterProgress giving the EExecutionState at each index of the ArrayIn input array.
This array can be filled with several data during one progress as it depends on the distribution process behind the block.
But the size of this array won't exceed the Input array size.
dataPorts.Error:
An array of ArrayFilterError giving an error object for the index of the ArrayIn input array.
The size of this array won't exceed the ArrayIn array size.

controlPorts.Success: is activated when the process is completed with success.
controlPorts.Progress: is activated each time a progress occurred.
controlPorts.Error: is activated when an error occurred.
